items.title: NIST Launches Center for AI in Manufacturing
items.author: webera@bnpmedia.com (Austin Weber)
items.summary:
- NIST will invest $20M with MITRE to create two AI-focused centers: AI Economic Security Center for U.S. Manufacturing Productivity and the AI Economic Security Center to secure critical infrastructure.
- Centers will develop evaluations and AI tools to accelerate adoption, boost competitiveness, protect AI leadership, counter misuse of AI, and reduce insecure AI risks.
- Officials say the investment will spur AI in manufacturing, support a renaissance, remove barriers to innovation, and catalyze new technologies.

items.title: Custom Workstations Improve Ergonomics
items.author: sprovierij@bnpmedia.com (John Sprovieri)
items.summary: - Ergonomic, adjustable workstations can boost productivity, cut absenteeism, and reduce workers’ comp costs. - 80/20 T-slot framing provides durable, modular, reusable components for rapid in-house customization. - Five design steps: define work zone, map workflow and surfaces, organize tools, implement adjustable surfaces, and choose mobility options.

items.title: Robots Automate Assembly at Machinery Factory
items.summary:
- Krone uses robotics and AMRs at Werlte and a newer Ibbenbüren plant to tackle skilled-labor shortages, with KUKA welding/handling robots and KMP AMRs delivering parts and moving assemblies.
- Ibbenbüren (opened 2023) is a connected smart factory with real-time coordination, tolerance and fault handling, and self-learning corrections enabling near-zero downtime.
- Automation is intended to augment human work—safer, ergonomically improved workplaces kept in Germany, with ramping capabilities and a focus on domestic production.

items.title: Chassis Combines Walking Beam and Belt Transfer Systems
items.author: sprovierij@bnpmedia.com (John Sprovieri)
items.summary:
- Stelron Components’ CWB chassis fuses walking-beam pallet transfer with a belt-driven pallet path for high-accuracy indexing and flexible operation, 1–2 lanes.
- Sankyo Automation’s RGR Series is a servo-driven rotary indexing table with a preloaded, zero-backlash mechanism, a torque-boosted motor, and a large through-bore.
- IKO International’s PDS X-Y stage enables precise 2‑D positioning; Cardinal Kinetic’s InoDrive offers an all-in-one servo controller with InoWorx and InoSync for synchronized multi‑axis motion.

items.title: Gigacasting: The Next Big Idea in Automotive Manufacturing?
items.author: webera@bnpmedia.com (Austin Weber)
items.summary:
- Gigacasting uses ultra-large aluminum die-casting to form single-piece structural components, cutting parts, weight and assembly.
- It requires a full ecosystem (furnaces, vacuum, automation, heat treatment) and retooled body shops, with QA and porosity controls as major challenges.
- Adoption signals (Tesla, Rivian, Ford Louisville, Honda Carat) show potential gains in stiffness and speed, but cost, tooling, energy use, and retrofit risks remain.

items.title: Santa’s Sleigh Gets a Retrofit, Courtesy of GE Aviation
items.author: webera@bnpmedia.com (Austin Weber)
items.summary:
- AI-optimized sleigh with propulsion options including two GE9X jet engines or a dual-mode ramjet.
- Predictive AI health monitoring enabling proactive maintenance and GE Aerospace standby support.
- Hybrid electric modes to boost speed and efficiency for record-year deliveries.

items.title: Software Helps Lockheed Improve Cost Estimation
items.author: sprovierij@bnpmedia.com (John Sprovieri)
items.summary:
- SEER-MFG links Lockheed's current airframe estimates to a historical cost database, boosting speed to about 2 days with ~5% greater accuracy.
- It maps metrics to a data matrix with weights to yield analogous estimates; fuel-tank cost done in 2 hours; 8,300-lb airframe from a week to a day; ECPs 40h→10h; trade studies 2 days→half; 5–10 proposals/mo.
- Future: a cost-characterization interface and CATIA-to-SEER-MFG plug-in; estimates could drop from hours to minutes, airframes from weeks to ~2 days.

items.title: Appliance Maker Clinches Stainless Steel Sheets
items.summary:
- V‑Zug AG uses a semi-automatic clinching line with a single-point C-frame press, ElectricDrive, 80 kN, 73 mm opening, and force/displacement sensors.
- The workflow loads three sheets and a 60 L tub; 15 clinch points per wall; two variants for trays per side and a 180° rotation to clinch the second wall.
- Interchangeable fixtures, touchscreen/Ethernet control, safety grids, and a ready-to-use setup that needs only power and compressed air, with expansion potential.

items.title: Pierce Manufacturing to Expand Fire Truck Factory
items.author: webera@bnpmedia.com (Austin Weber)
items.summary:
- Pierce expands Appleton with >$150M across WI, FL, TN, adding 500,000 sq ft to speed ladders, platforms, pumpers and tankers and reduce lead times.
- Penta 30K laser cuts up to 2 in steel with beveled edges; automated panel bender; semi-automatic folding; automated rail welding; handheld laser welding; buffing robots; AI sanding.
- Paint shop adds 26k sq ft, new booths and ovens; release line moved; cab/chassis reconfigured in 224k sq ft to boost capacity and delivery.

items.title: GM Plans Longer Than Usual Holiday Closures at Multiple Plants
items.summary:
- GM extends holiday shutdowns at Flint Assembly (Dec 24, 2025–Jan 26, 2026), affecting Silverado HD and Sierra HD production for planned maintenance and project work.
- Bowling Green Corvette plant will shut about four weeks, longer than the usual two weeks, as inventory management to slow winter sales of unsold 2024–2026 Corvettes.
- Shutdowns appear driven by maintenance and inventory alignment rather than demand; chatter links a Gen 6 small-block V8 launch to the 2027 model year.

items.title: Start-up Aims to Make Humanoid Robots for Military
items.summary:
- Foundation Future Industries in San Francisco is building the Phantom humanoid for U.S. military use.
- The 5'9", 180 lb robot carries up to 44 lb payload (incl. weapons) with plans to scale production and lease models for surveillance, logistics, and dangerous environments; CEO Sankaet Pathak argues weaponization is necessary.
- Design features include an upper torso with computers/batteries/sensors, a mobile lower torso, and cycloid actuators that blend hydraulic-like power with electric efficiency for stairs, uneven terrain, and tight spaces.

items.title: Hybrid Drives Turn Robots Into Precision Machining Tools
items.summary:
- A hybrid drive blends direct (precision/speed) with indirect drives (robust power) in a six-axis robot, reducing vibration and approaching tool-like precision at high feed rates.
- The system enables additive and subtractive work in one cell, building layer by layer and refinishing without re-clamping for compact SME manufacturing.
- Led by Siemens and Fraunhofer IFAM, pilots test reliable path control; researchers aim to apply the concept to other machines for versatile, sustainable automation.

items.title: New Technology Can Create Composite Structures in Space
items.summary:
- NIAR and Wichita State Univ. built a dual-robot AFP system for in-space fabrication of thermoplastic composites without tooling (AToM).
- It uses laser-heated deposition and synchronized consolidation to bond 3D parts directly in orbit with in-situ consolidation.
- In-space fabrication instead of Earth shipping reduces launch mass and enables tool-less, large, mission-tailored space habitats.

items.title: System Dispenses Thermal Paste Without Bubbles
items.summary:
- BorgWarner partners with ViscoTec to enable bubble-free, precisely dosed thermal paste for EV power electronics cooling.
- The ViscoMT-XS handles large containers (5–50 L) and a vertical progressive cavity pump delivers up to 810 mL/min, with nearly complete emptying.
- A ViscoTreat-I stage stirs and degasses the paste to remove air pockets and ensure even particle distribution before dispensing.

items.title: Developing Automation Products: From Napkin-Sketch to the Factory Floor
items.summary: - IPR Robotics champions a customer-led, phased NPD approach, splitting ideas into sprints or validated new-market solutions, with early ROI validation and 3–4 engaged customers. - StackTrax is a floor-based seventh-axis rail built from modular components for rapid customization, six-week lead times, and scalability so one robot can service multiple machines. - The approach reduces internal friction (fewer meetings) and enables easy control integration of the hybrid steel-concrete rails, with idle-time savings of ~5–6 hours/week and ROI-focused, plug‑and‑play readiness.

items.title: Volkswagen Announces First-Ever Production Closure at German Plant
Beyond Aero Reveals Plans for Next-Generation Aerospace Factory
Volvo Autonomous Solutions Begins Production of Autonomous Mining Trucks
Boeing Finalizes $4.7B Acquisition of Spirit AeroSystems
US Manufacturers Make Big Plans in 2025
items.author: sprovierij@bnpmedia.com (John Sprovieri)
items.summary:
- Tariffs push cost pressure and uncertainty for automation integrators; lead times post-COVID more predictable, though some servo/vision parts still delayed; diversification and early sourcing help.
- 2025 is mixed for suppliers; tariff stability may spur investment; 2026 expected to improve as OEMs shift to hybrids/fuel cells and reshoring grows; lines relocating to the U.S.
- Investment in automation continues amid labor shortages; examples: Orbitform, Fein, Visumatic, PVA, MC Machinery; 2026 outlook very good.

items.title: Research Project Aims to Expand Aluminum Use in Auto Industry
items.author: webera@bnpmedia.com (Austin Weber)

items.title: New Initiative Focuses on Robot Communication
items.author: webera@bnpmedia.com (Austin Weber)
items.summary:
- VDMA's OPC Robotics Initiative released v1.02 of the OPC Robotics Companion Specification, enabling high-level robot control, remote operation, and vendor-independent asset access.
- The spec defines a unified motion-device system and a common interface, turning robots into intelligent assets for secure, interoperable data exchange and anomaly detection.
- It supports Industry 4.0, cloud data usage and data spaces like Manufacturing-X and Catena-X; Part 1 covers asset management, condition monitoring and remote operation.

items.title: NIST Report Calls for Sustainable Metals Infrastructure
items.author: webera@bnpmedia.com (Austin Weber)
items.summary:
- Calls for a life-cycle metals infrastructure spanning mining to recycling to boost efficiency, resilience, and resource security.
- Highlights emerging extraction/processing tech and data tools for designing advanced alloys, and identifies critical materials like Li, Co, and superalloys.
- Advocates diversifying supply, seeking substitutes, improving recycling, tighter reuse standards, and new certification for recycled-content products.

items.title: New Tool Controller Increases Flexibility, Improves Maintenance
items.summary:
- AXON standardizes diverse tools with a single controller, supports tools back to 2010, and reduces backup hardware.
- Real-time analytics (DeMeter) and location services (Nexonar) enable live visibility and aim to prevent recalls, plus recyclable packaging for sustainability.
- A modular, swappable design with a single protocol supports open integration, a smaller footprint (30% smaller), and potential to replace legacy platforms; MAX 2026 is upcoming.

items.title: Airbus Faces A Pair of A320 Quality Issues Over the Course of a Few Days
items.summary:
- Airbus disclosed a new industrial quality issue affecting metal fuselage panels from an unnamed supplier, about 50 aircraft in production; issue identified and contained, with no evidence affected parts are in service.
- The issue follows a weekend grounding of over half the global A320 fleet for a solar-flare software update; fewer than 100 aircraft require deeper hardware checks, with Airbus aiming about 820 deliveries in 2025.
- Impact depends on panel location; only a portion of affected aircraft may need further action, with airlines such as Lufthansa and easyJet seeing share slips amid delay concerns.

items.title: Cobots May Enable Autistic Adults to Thrive in Manufacturing
items.author: webera@bnpmedia.com (Austin Weber)

items.title: Epson Robot Wins New Product of the Year
items.summary:
- Epson's GX-C Series SCARA robot won New Product of the Year in The Assembly Show's robotics category, aiming to boost efficiency, precision, and cost savings.
- The update highlights flexible feeding, soldering automation, and previews of the Manufacturing and Automation Exchange in March.
- The piece promotes Ask ASM, an AI search tool for assembly topics, and notes options to reprint articles as PDFs or custom plaques.

items.title: Inside LG’s Smart Factory
items.author: webera@bnpmedia.com (Austin Weber)
items.summary:
- LG Clarksville (100k sq ft) runs 1 washer ~13 s and 1 dryer ~11 s with 900+ workers, 200 mobile robots, 130 fixed robots; digital twins and 5G drive 17% productivity and 30% energy savings.
- In-house stamping/molding; 1.2M washers and 600k dryers yearly; 20k floor QR codes, 200 AGVs/AMRs, 250 Wi-Fi APs; AI inventory trims space ~30% and handling ~25%.
- Real-time digital twins and AI enable predictive maintenance and QA; six-camera end-of-line inspection; defect returns down 70%; AGVs to AMRs planned; 65% fastening automated.

items.title: Lasers Etch Precise Marks on Small Titanium Devices
items.author: sprovierij@bnpmedia.com (John Sprovieri)
items.summary:
- Titanium valves for hydrocephalus require traceable, corrosion-free marks; markings must be contamination-free to preserve biocompatibility after sterilization.
- Ultrashort laser pulses from Trumpf TruMicro Mark create matte-black marks on titanium without ablation, keeping surfaces biocompatible and legible under bright surgery lamps.
- A Miethke–Trumpf collaboration tightens laser configuration for curved valve surfaces; future work adds data processing to the marking workflow.

items.title: Workers Believe Robots Are More a Help Than a Hindrance
items.author: sprovierij@bnpmedia.com (John Sprovieri)
items.summary:
- From GM's 1961 Unimate to mass automation, early worker suspicion gave way to acceptance as robots boosted throughput and safety.
- A 50-year survey of 1,000 workers across the US, China, Japan, the UK and Germany finds most see robots boosting competitiveness and safety (69% address shortages; 75% reduce injuries; 65% help older workers stay employed).
- In the US, optimism lags peers (60% expect better jobs; 67% see higher quality), but AI-enabled, easy-to-program robots are easing adoption and boosting manager buy-in.

items.title: Boeing Strike in St. Louis Ends as Union Approves New Contract
items.summary: - A three-month strike by IAMAW at Boeing Defense in the St. Louis area ended with roughly 3,200 members voting 68% in favor of a new five-year contract.\n- The agreement includes a $6,000 signing bonus (up from $5,000) and a 24% general wage increase, but does not meet several union demands such as a $10,000 ratification bonus or 401(k) match.\n- Union leaders praised member solidarity and said they will press for better benefits in future negotiations, while Boeing emphasized stability and said all union members will return under the ratified offer as production resumes.

items.title: Suppliers Navigate Lidar Assembly Challenges
items.summary:
- LiDAR enables centimeter-level 3D mapping and real-time object detection for ADAS/AV, with multiple architectures and camera/radar fusion.
- Valeo’s Wemding plant uses end-of-line calibration and simulation-driven validation to safeguard long-range accuracy; regional sensor placement varies by market.
- China-led growth with Hesai/RoboSense; Hesai ETX with photon-vector tech; Ouster’s digital lidar; factories rely on automation and AI-driven QA.

items.title: Stellantis to Assemble New Midsize Truck at Illinois Factory
items.summary:
- Stellantis will reopen the Belvidere, IL plant in 2027 to build a new midsize truck; powertrain not specified.
- About 960 former workers remain on the recall list as of Sept. 23, down from ~1,800 at the Feb 2023 closure.
- The move follows a rethink after canceling a fully electric Ram and Jeep Gladiator 4xe; Belvidere received $335M for electrification under a $1.7B DOE grant.

items.title: Humanoid Robots Complete Trial Project at BMW Assembly Plant
items.summary:
- BMW ran an 11-month Spartanburg pilot with two Figure AI humanoids, totaling ~1,250 hours and contributing to the production of over 30,000 X3s by loading parts and guiding welding.
- Goals included loading within 37s, completing the task in 84s, and 99% per-shift success; data from Figure 02 informed the Figure 03 design.
- Forearm was the top hardware failure point; wrist electronics were redesigned to remove the distribution board, enabling direct main-computer control and improved reliability.

items.title: Rockwell Automation to Build Assembly Plant in Wisconsin
items.summary:
- Rockwell plans a greenfield site in southeastern Wisconsin as part of a five-year, $2B program to expand plants, digital infrastructure and talent.
- The site could become Rockwell’s largest campus, with 1+ million sq ft of manufacturing/warehouse space and advanced automation, robotics, and AI analytics.
- The project signals a broader U.S. manufacturing investment in digital capabilities, framed as shaping future operations and expanding the footprint, with IoT lessons from Twinsburg.

items.title: First Solar Opens $1.1 Billion, AI-Enabled Assembly Plant in Louisiana
items.summary:
- First Solar opened a $1.1B, 2.4M sq ft plant in Iberia Parish, LA, with 700+ jobs (826 projected) and 3.5 GW/yr at full capacity.
- Produces Series 7 modules from American-made materials, with no Chinese silicon supply dependencies; AI for defect detection and operator decision support.
- Part of the Western Hemisphere's largest solar tech footprint, with Ohio and AL plants and R&D; includes a $330M Series 6 line in SC to onshore final production.

items.title: The Connected Worker Manufacturing Stack
items.summary:
- Epicor's four-layer stack: ERP, MES, Connected Worker, and AI overlay, letting AI span all layers to improve data access, visibility, quality, and cycle-time control.
- A unified stack aims to replace patchwork solutions, enabling end-to-end data flow and faster decisions, with AI-enabled insights across ERP, MES, and connected worker.
- Guidance emphasizes scalable vendors with customer references, including 5-10 year plans, so vendors can grow from mid-market to enterprise; Epicor targets Kinetic and expansion.

items.title: GM Secures Four R&D 100 Awards for Breakthrough Manufacturing and Battery Technologies
items.summary:
- GM wins four R&D 100 Awards for breakthroughs in digital manufacturing, battery science, propulsion, and materials, including DR-Weld (with Oak Ridge National Laboratory) that runs thousands of times faster than commercial software.
- Extreme Fast-Charging, Affordable EV Battery Cell Architecture enables rapid energy intake and cost efficiency, already deployed in racing and shaping future consumer EV fast charging.
- Low-Mass, High-Efficiency Medium-Duty Truck Engine cuts weight ~15% and improves fuel efficiency >10%, with testing across federal labs and academia, plus Ultra-Robust Silicon All-Solid-State Battery delivering safety and cycle-life gains toward high-energy cells.

items.title: GM Invests $250 Million in Parma Metal Center in Ohio
items.summary:
- GM commits $250M to Parma Metal Center (Parma, OH) to expand stamping/assembly, feeding Orion (MI), Spring Hill (TN), and Fairfax (KS).
- Part of GM's $5.5B 2025 investments to boost domestic capacity and resilient supply chains for ICE/EV, with workforce training and apprenticeships.
- Parma Center has 75+ years of operation, >100M parts/year, 400+ tons of steel daily, supplying most GM NA vehicles.
